Class Map

java.lang.Object
  Map

public class Map
extends java.lang.Object

Map class keeps track objects on the playing grid, helper methods to make movement decisions, and export/import methods for the editor

Author:
Ramsey Kant

Constructor Detail

Map

public Map(int w,
           int h,
           int cs)
Class constructor, inits a blank map based on a width, height, and cell size Used in the editor

Parameters:
w - Width of the map
h - Height of the map
cs - Size of individual cells in pixels

Map

public Map(java.lang.String filename,
           int cs)
Class Constructor that reads the map data from filename

Parameters:
filename - The file name of the map to read contents from
cs - Size of individual cells in pixels. This is something that should be deteremined by graphics, not the mapfile

getDotsRemaining

public int getDotsRemaining()
Return the number of dots remaining on the map. This is tracked by the dotsRemaining local var (not a loop and count in itemMap)

Returns:
dots remaining

public Player getPlayer()
Find and return the player object within the local actorList ArrayList

Returns:
The player object. null if not found

getActor

public Actor getActor(int x,
                      int y,
                      boolean notPlayer)
Return an actor at coordinate (x,y)

Parameters:
x - X Coordinate
y - Y Coordinate
notPlayer - If true, ignore a "Player" actor at (x,y)
Returns:
Actor (null if an actor doesn't exist at the position)

removeActor

public void removeActor(int idx)
Remove an actor from actorList based on index. Be careful when using this! Just because an actor isn't in the map doesn't mean it's not 'alive' This is primarily for the editor

Parameters:
idx - Index of the actor

removeItem

public void removeItem(int x,
                       int y)
Remove an item from the item array by coordinate (x, y)

Parameters:
x - X coordinate of the item
y - Y coordinate of the item

removeAnyAt

public boolean removeAnyAt(int x,
                           int y)
Remove everything at coordiante (x,y) Used by the editor only

Parameters:
x - X coordinate
y - Y coordinate
Returns:
boolean True if something was removed, false if otherwise

                        GameObject end)
Find the distance (Manhattan) between two objects

Parameters:

Returns:
Distance (integer)

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty(int x,
                       int y)
Check if a coordinate is completely empty (void of actorList, items, and collissions) Used by the editor

Parameters:
x - A x coordinate to move to
y - A y coordinate to move to
Returns:
True if empty. False if otherwise

canMove

public boolean canMove(Actor act,
                       int x,
                       int y)
Move attempt method. Changes the position the map of the game object if there are no obstructions

Parameters:
act - The actor object trying to move
x - A x coordinate to move to
y - A y coordinate to move to
Returns:
True if the move succeeded. False if otherwise

getCost

public float getCost(Actor mover,
                     int sx,
                     int sy,
                     int tx,
                     int ty)
Get the cost of moving through the given tile. This can be used to make certain areas more desirable. A simple and valid implementation of this method would be to return 1 in all cases.

Parameters:
mover - The mover that is trying to move across the tile
sx - The x coordinate of the tile we're moving from
sy - The y coordinate of the tile we're moving from
tx - The x coordinate of the tile we're moving to
ty - The y coordinate of the tile we're moving to
Returns:
The relative cost of moving across the given tile

write

public void write(java.lang.String filename)
Write the contents of this map to a file in the correct format

Parameters:
filename - File name of the map

read

private void read(java.lang.String filename)
Read a file with map contents and set the properties in this map Called by the constructor.

Parameters:
filename - File name of the map
